text: (upbeat music)

- [Instructor] In this
video, we will show you

how to use AWS Migration Hub
templates to create a journey
and to start collaborating with experts
to meet your migration goals.
We'll introduce the following concepts,

migration journeys, migration
templates, phases, modules,

tasks, and sub-tasks.
(upbeat music)

New migration hub capability
helps customers, partners,

and AWS practitioners
collaborate on planning
and managing their migration journey.

It also provides the same
view and up-to-date guidance
on each task in the journey.
(upbeat music)

A template defines a
set of phases, modules,
and tasks that represent a specific type

of migration scenario with
detailed execution steps
for each task.

It also suggests AWS
tools and best practices
for a given migration approach.

Migration Hub comes
with standard templates

that cover basic patterns for
example, database migration,

but many customers and
partners choose to create
their own templates that suit their needs.
(upbeat music)

Each template is created
by migration experts

and consists of phases such
as assess through operate.

Each phase consists of
modules that helps you
meet a specific business requirement,
such as migration readiness assessment.

Each module sub devised
into discrete units
of work call tasks.
When all tasks are executed,
the migration journey is complete.

The template offers overall
guidance on task completion,

including tools to use
and acceptance criteria.
(upbeat music)
When you create a journey from a template,

the overview tab will show
details such as Journey status,

Journey Amazon Resource
Names, migration space,

task details, including all
tasks and specific tasks
assigned to the person logged in.
(upbeat music)

Faces are the top level
view in a migration journey.

They typically follow a set
of framework or big buckets

that a team wants to
define for their migration.
For example, assess, mobilize, migrate,
and operate our typical phases defined
in the cloud adoption framework.
(upbeat music)

The next level below a
phase is called the module.
Modules are collections of tasks

that help you meet a
particular business goal.

For example, if you need
to track all required tasks

for a migration kickoff,
you can assign those tasks

under one single module
and check on the progress.
(upbeat music)

A task is a single unit of
work that you can assign
to an individual or a team.

Each task can hold
information such as steps
to perform the task, tools and guidance,

due date and assignee.
(upbeat music)

Here are some of the available
details for a typical task.
Tasks can be manual or automated.
(upbeat music)

You can set up a journey
on someone's behalf

in your own migration space,
and then transfer the journey
to another migration space when needed.
There are no limits on the number
of migration journey transfers.
A migration space that owns a journey
owns all the data in that journey.
(upbeat music)

You can easily create a copy
of your existing journey.

Here's how, in the Actions
menu, choose copy journey,
name the New journey, review the details
of what will be copied over.

Click the copy journey button.
(upbeat music)
